org.jtrim2.access

Class AccessRequest<IDType,RightType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.access.AccessRequest<IDType,RightType>
  • Type Parameters:
    IDType - the type of the request id. The request ID is strongly recommended to be immutable.
    RightType - the type of rights the request contains. The rights are strongly recommended to be immutable.

    public final class AccessRequest<IDType,RightType>
extends Object
    Defines the access request passed to an AccessManager. The request contains rights to which only read access is required and rights which require exclusive access.

    Every request also contains a request id which is intended to be used to identify the reason the right was requested. The ID is not required to be unique amongst requests.

    To create right request with only a single read or write access request you can use to following convenience factory methods:

    • getReadRequest(IDType, RightType)
    • getWriteRequest(IDType, RightType)

    Conflicting rights are allowed in a single right request.

    1. Two rights are said to be conflicting if their domains intersect and at least one of them is a write request. rights.
    2. If the domain of rights intersect or not is defined by the implementation of the AccessManager.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are immutable and as such are thread-safe even in the face of unsynchronized concurrent access. Note that although instances are immutable, the rights (getReadRights(), () getWriteRights()) and the request id are not necessarily immutable. Note however that it is strongly recommended to use immutable types for rights and the request id.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    AccessManager, AccessToken

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessRequest

        public AccessRequest(IDType requestID,
                     Collection<? extends RightType> readRights,
                     Collection<? extends RightType> writeRights)
        Creates a new access request with the specified read and write rights and the request id.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the identifier used to refer to this request. Such identifier does not need to unique amongst requests; they are intended to be used to determine if an access token requested by this request can be canceled. This argument cannot be null.
        readRights - the read rights to be requested. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty collection. The passed collection will be copied and no reference will be retained to it by the newly created object.
        writeRights - the write rights to be requested. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty collection. The passed collection will be copied and no reference will be retained to it by the newly created object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if the requestID is null

      • AccessRequest

        public AccessRequest(IDType requestID,
                     RightType[] readRights,
                     RightType[] writeRights)
        Creates a new access request with the specified read and write rights and the request id.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the identifier used to refer to this request. Such identifier does not need to unique amongst requests; they are intended to be used to determine if an access token requested by this request can be canceled. This argument cannot be null.
        readRights - the read rights to be requested. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty array. The passed array will be copied and no reference will be retained to it by the newly created object.
        writeRights - the write rights to be requested. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty array. The passed array will be copied and no reference will be retained to it by the newly created object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if the requestID is null

    • Method Detail

      • getReadRequest

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessRequest<IDType,RightType> getReadRequest(IDType requestID,
                                                                                RightType readRight)
        Creates an access request with a single read right request.
        • getReadRights() will return a collection with a single element specified by the readRight argument
        • getWriteRights() will return an empty collection
        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the read right
        Parameters:
        requestID - the ID identifying this request. See: getRequestID(). This argument cannot be null.
        readRight - the single read right which is to be requested. This argument can be null; note however that not every AccessManager implementation accepts null rights.
        Returns:
        the newly created access request representing the single specified read right. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if the request id is null

      • getWriteRequest

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessRequest<IDType,RightType> getWriteRequest(IDType requestID,
                                                                                 RightType writeRight)
        Creates an access request with a single write right request.
        • getReadRights() will return an empty collection
        • getWriteRights() will return a collection with a single element specified by the writeRight argument
        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the read right
        Parameters:
        requestID - the ID identifying this request. See: getRequestID(). This argument cannot be null.
        writeRight - the single write right which is to be requested. This argument can be null; note however that not every AccessManager implementation accepts null rights.
        Returns:
        the newly created access request representing the single specified write right. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if the requestID is null

      • getRequestID

        public IDType getRequestID()
        Returns the identifier used to refer to this request. This identifier is intended to be used to determine if an access token requested by this request can be canceled. AccessManagers must pass this identifier to the newly created AccessToken.

        Note that this identifier is not required to unique.

        Returns:
        the identifier of this request. This method never returns null.

      • getReadRights

        public Collection<RightType> getReadRights()
        Returns a read-only collection of read right requests. The returned rights are allowed to conflict with write right requests and can (though not recommended) contain the same rights multiple times.
        Returns:
        the collection of read right requests. This method never returns null but may return an empty collection.

      • getWriteRights

        public Collection<RightType> getWriteRights()
        Returns a read-only collection of write right requests. The returned rights are allowed to contain conflicting rights and can (though not recommended) contain the same rights multiple times.
        Returns:
        the collection of write right requests. This method never returns null but may return an empty collection.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this access request in no particular format.

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
